data.title: Florence: A New Foundation for Computer Vision
data.description: Microsoft Research recently released the foundational Florence model, setting the state of the art across a wide array of computer vision tasks.

data.title: Remote, Not Distant
data.description: As Roboflow has grown, we have put a great deal of effort into creating an unparalleled remote-first workplace. data.title: Who cares about Nemo, let's find some Sexy Shrimp!
data.description: Creating a computer vision model with Roboflow to detect sexy shrimp.

data.title: Using Computer Vision to Play Dreidel
data.description: As a brand new employee at Roboflow, I was asked to do a computer vision project. So I thought, why not combine a holiday I love so much, Chanukah, with something brand new in my life, Roboflow.

data.title: Roboflow Changelog: November 2021
data.description: It's been a whirlwind of a month at Roboflow with lots of changes, updates, and expansion going on behind the scenes. data.title: ReefOS: Supercharging Coral Reef Restoration with AI
data.description: ReefOS, an AI platform enabling everyone to survey corals in real-time and help save them.

data.title: What's New in YOLOS?
data.description: YOLOS - You Only Look At One Sequence is the newest, and potentially most impactful, iteration on the YOLO family of object detection models.

data.title: The Future of Football: AI-Assisted Coaches
data.description: Scott Bronkema is a former college football player turned software developer. As Scott started tinkering with computer vision, he discovered he can build every football coach's dream application: the automated playbook. Bronkema's product automatically identifies offensive and defensive player positions and formations and then tracks players' movements as the play

data.title: Let's Talk About Company Culture
data.description: Company culture is a feeling in the air, the social norms of a group, the manifestation of collective goals and beliefs, and the one intangible thing that can make or break a growth stage company. For some, culture becomes a priority too late in the business. It starts to become

data.title: YOLOv5 v6.0 is here - new Nano model at 1666 FPS
data.description: With the v6.0 release, YOLOv5 further solidifies its position as the leading object detection model and repository.

data.title: New Feature: Isolate Objects
data.description: You can now export the bounding boxes from your object detection dataset as cropped images usable with classification models. This update will enable easily prototyping two-pass models for use-cases like OCR and object tracking. Isolate Objects is now available as a preprocessing step.To try it out, simply enable the

data.title: Engineer's Guide to Figma
data.description: Your designer sent over a url that begins with figma.com and asks you to take a look at their latest work. What is Figma, you wonder as you click through a series of screens, and how can I learn more about it? Wonder no more — you’ve come to

data.title: How to Safely Install OpenCV on the Mac M1
data.description: Installing OpenCV on the M1 safely is difficult because the M1 operates on an arm64 architecture and most of your python libraries are compiled for amd64. Open this guide to avoid your otherwise inevitable demise.

data.title: Roboflow Changelog: October 2021
data.description: Our emphasis this month was on "code tentacles", or improving the ways that Roboflow integrates with your codebase. Below is a recap of what we launched and improved. data.title: Roboflow and Ultralytics Partner to Streamline YOLOv5 MLOps
data.description: We're proud to share that Roboflow has entered into a partnership agreement with Ultralytics, the creators of YOLOv5, and that Roboflow is now the official dataset management and annotation tool for YOLOv5 with a focus on enabling active learning. data.title: Making a Handheld Card Counter on the OAK-D-Lite
data.description: The portability of the OAK-D-Lite gives us the power to bring computer vision powered solutions anywhere on earth - including your local casino!

data.title: Deploying Computer Vision Models as Mircroservices
data.description: Roboflow's philosophy around MLOps revolves around treating your computer vision model as a microservice. The reasons for this are myriad; in this post we highlight the benefits of this approach and how it works in practice. data.title: How I Used Computer Vision to Make Sense of My Fridge
data.description: As part of a groupwork for a postgraduate applied AI at Erasmus Brussels we made an object detection model to identify ingredients in a fridge.

data.title: We Raised a $20M Series A to Continue Democratizing Computer Vision

data.description: "ML in a Minute" is our conversational series on answering machine learning questions. Have questions you want answered? Tweet at us.
